parameters.parameter: - [SafeMode?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.
- [-> VAR/CAP "NAME"]: The name of the variable where the result of the JS expression will be stored

item.example:
PuppeteerExecuteJs -> VAR "PageTitle" "document.title;"
PuppeteerExecuteJs -> CAP "AllLinks" "Array.from(document.links).map(a => a.href);"
PuppeteerExecuteJs "alert('hello world');"

notes.note: The result of the expression is converted into a JSON string and stored in the specified variable.

item.name: Open Browser
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumOpenBrowser' block initializes and opens a new browser session using the Selenium WebDriver. It supports various configurations, including custom command line arguments and user agents, to tailor the browser environment for specific tasks.

parameters.parameter: - ["ExtraCmdLineArgs" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.]: Extra Cmd Line Args" description="Additional command line arguments to customize the browser's launch settings.
- ["CustomUserAgent" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.]: A custom user agent string to be used by the browser.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

item.example: SeleniumOpenBrowser "--disable-gpu --start-maximized" "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/58.0.3029.110 Safari/537.36"

notes.note: Ensure that the Selenium WebDriver for the desired browser is correctly configured and accessible.
Command line arguments and user agents should be tested for compatibility with the target website.
This block will initiate a new browser session; existing sessions must be closed to open a new one.

item.name: New Tab
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumNewTab' block in Selenium is used to open a new page in a new browser tab. This function is essential for performing tasks that require multiple tabs within the same browser session.

parameters.parameter: - [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Ensure that the current browser session is capable of tab management.
All actions following this block will take place in the new tab context unless switched back.

item.name: Full Screen
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumFullScreen' block is designed to maximize the browser window to full screen, providing an expanded view for web automation tasks.

parameters.parameter: - [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Consider the visual aspect of web elements in the full-screen mode as it may differ from the windowed mode.

item.name: Minimize
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumMinimize' block allows for minimizing the browser window during Selenium-driven web automation processes. This feature is useful in scenarios where minimizing the browser can simulate certain user behaviors or when it's necessary to reduce the visual footprint of automated tasks.

parameters.parameter: - [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: The behavior of the 'Minimize' block may vary depending on the operating system and the browser's version.
Some web pages might behave differently when viewed in a minimized window, affecting the outcome of automated tasks.

item.name: Maximize
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumMaximize' block is designed to maximize the browser window during Selenium web automation processes. This action is particularly useful for ensuring that web elements are visible and interactable on screen, enhancing the reliability of the automation.

parameters.parameter: - [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Maximizing the browser can help avoid issues related to element visibility or screen resolution dependencies.
Consider the screen resolution of the environment where the script will run, as it might affect the maximized window size.

item.name: Go Back
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumGoBack' block is used to navigate back to the previously visited page in a Selenium-driven browser. This function mimics the action of the 'back' button in a web browser, allowing automated navigation through browsing history.

parameters.parameter: - [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: This action can only be performed if there is a page in the browser's history to go back to.

item.name: Go Forward
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumGoForward' block facilitates the navigation to the next page in the browser’s history, emulating the forward button typically found in web browsers. It is useful for scenarios that involve step-wise navigation through previously visited pages.

parameters.parameter: - [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: This action is only viable if there is a subsequent page in the browsing history to navigate to.

item.name: Reload
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumReload' block is designed to refresh the current page in the browser. It's an essential tool for testing the behavior of web applications after a page reload, ensuring that the state is maintained or updated correctly.

parameters.parameter: - [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Be aware that reloading a page may lead to loss of any unsaved data on the page, similar to manually refreshing a page in the browser.

item.name: Set Browser Size
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumSetBrowserSize' block allows for the dynamic adjustment of the browser window size. This functionality is crucial for testing responsive web designs and ensuring compatibility across different screen sizes.

parameters.parameter: - WIDTH / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The desired width of the browser window in pixels.
- HEIGHT / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The desired height of the browser window in pixels.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

item.example: SeleniumSetBrowserSize 1920 1080 ## Sets the browser size to 1920x1080 pixels.

notes.note: Setting an extremely large size might exceed the screen resolution and cause unexpected behavior.

item.name: Switch to Tab
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumSwitchToTab' block allows switching to a different browser tab by specifying its index. This is particularly useful in scenarios where multiple tabs are open, and specific actions need to be performed on different tabs.

parameters.parameter: - INDEX / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The zero-based index of the browser tab to switch to.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

item.example: SeleniumSwitchToTab 1 ## Switches to the second tab in the browser (index starts from 0)

notes.note: Ensure the specified index corresponds to an existing tab; otherwise, an error will occur.
Tab indices start at 0, with 0 being the first tab.

item.name: Close Tab
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumCloseTab' block is designed to close the currently active browser tab. This function is useful for managing multiple tabs within a browser session, especially when certain operations only need to be performed on specific tabs.

parameters.parameter: - [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: If the closed tab is the last one in the browser, the entire browser window may close depending on the browser's settings.

item.name: Close Browser
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumCloseBrowser' block is used to close an open Selenium browser session. This function is crucial for properly terminating a browser session and releasing resources at the end of a test script or upon completion of specific automated tasks.

parameters.parameter: - [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Ensure that all necessary actions have been performed before closing the browser, as this will terminate the session.

item.name: Click
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumClick' block is designed to perform a click action on a specified element on the web page. It supports various methods to locate the target element, enhancing flexibility and precision in interacting with web page elements.

parameters.parameter: - [FindElementBy]: The method used to locate the element (e.g., Id, Name, XPath).
- "Identifier" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The identifier used in conjunction with 'FindElementBy' to select the element.
- [Index / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.]: Optional. Specifies the index of the element when multiple elements match the identifier.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

item.example: SeleniumClick Id "submit-button" 0 ## Clicks the first element with the Id 'submit-button'

notes.note: Ensure the element is visible and clickable at the time of execution to avoid errors.
Consider using waits to handle dynamic web elements or pages with AJAX calls.

item.name: Exists
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumExists' block is used to check the presence of a specific element on a web page. It evaluates whether the specified element exists and returns the result as a boolean value, providing a way to conditionally handle elements in automation scripts.

parameters.parameter: - [FindElementBy]: The method used to locate the element (e.g., Id, Name, XPath).
- ["Identifier" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.]: The identifier used in conjunction with 'FindElementBy' to select the element.
- [Index / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.]: Optional. Specifies the index of the element when multiple elements match the identifier.
- -> VAR/CAP "NAME": The name of the variable where the result (true/false) will be stored.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: The existence check does not necessarily imply that the element is visible or interactable at the time of the check.

item.name: Get Attribute Value
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumGetAttributeValue' block retrieves the value of a specified attribute from a selected element. It is used to extract dynamic or static attributes like class, style, or custom attributes from web elements in the browser.

parameters.parameter: - [FindElementBy]: The method used to locate the element (e.g., Id, Name, XPath).
- "Identifier" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The identifier used in conjunction with 'FindElementBy' to select the element.
- [Index / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.]: Optional. Specifies the index of the element when multiple elements match the identifier.
- ["AttributeName" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.]: The name of the attribute whose value is to be retrieved.
- -> VAR/CAP "NAME": The name of the variable where the retrieved value will be stored.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Use the correct attribute name as per the HTML of the page. Common attributes include 'href', 'src', 'value', etc.

item.name: Get Attribute Value All
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumGetAttributeValueAll' block is designed to retrieve values of a specified attribute from multiple elements. It is particularly useful for extracting data from lists or collections of similar elements, such as links, images, or input fields.

parameters.parameter: - [FindElementBy]: Method to locate the elements (e.g., Class, Selector, XPath).
- "Identifier" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: Identifier used to select the elements.
- ["AttributeName" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.]: The attribute whose values are to be retrieved from the elements.
- -> VAR/CAP "NAME": Name of the variable where the retrieved values will be stored.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: It's important to select a proper identifier to match all relevant elements.

item.name: Set Attribute Value
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumSetAttributeValue' block is utilized to modify or set the value of a specific attribute of an element on a webpage. This functionality is essential when there's a need to dynamically alter properties of web elements during automated web interactions.

parameters.parameter: - [FindElementBy]: Method to locate the element (e.g., Class, Selector, XPath).
- "Identifier" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: Identifier to select the element.
- Index / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The index of the element in case of multiple matching elements.
- "AttributeName" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The attribute whose value is to be set.
- "Value" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The value to be set for the attribute.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Ensure correct element selection to avoid unintended modifications.

item.name: Get Height
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumGetHeight' block retrieves the height of a specified web element in pixels. This is useful for tasks that require knowledge of element dimensions, such as layout testing or dynamic content adjustment.

parameters.parameter: - [FindElementBy]: Method to locate the element (e.g., Class, Selector, XPath).
- "Identifier" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: Identifier to select the element.
- [Index / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.]: The index of the element in case of multiple matching elements.
- -> VAR/CAP "NAME": Variable name to store the height of the element.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Ensure correct element selection to avoid errors in height retrieval.
Height is returned in pixels and stored as a string variable.

item.name: Get Width
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumGetWidth' block retrieves the width of a specific web element in pixels. It is particularly useful in scenarios where the size of elements is critical, such as in layout design or responsive web design testing.

parameters.parameter: - [FindElementBy]: The method used to locate the element (e.g., Class, Selector, XPath).
- "Identifier" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The identifier for selecting the element.
- [Index / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.]: The index of the element in case there are multiple matching elements.
- -> VAR/CAP "NAME": The variable name to store the width of the element.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Width is retrieved in pixels and stored as a string in the specified variable.
Correct element selection is crucial to avoid errors and obtain accurate width measurements.

item.name: Get Position X
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumGetPositionX' block retrieves the X coordinate of a specified web element, providing its position in pixels from the left edge of the browser window. This is useful for tasks involving element positioning and layout analysis.

parameters.parameter: - [FindElementBy]: The method used to locate the element (e.g., ClassName, Selector, XPath).
- "Identifier" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The identifier for selecting the element.
- [Index / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.]: The index of the element in case there are multiple matching elements.
- -> VAR/CAP "NAME": The variable name to store the X coordinate of the element.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: The X coordinate is measured in pixels from the left edge of the browser window.
Ensure accurate element identification to obtain a precise X coordinate value.

item.name: Get Position Y
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumGetPositionY' block retrieves the Y coordinate of a specified web element, indicating its position in pixels from the top edge of the browser window. It's useful for identifying the vertical positioning of elements on a webpage.

parameters.parameter: - [FindElementBy]: The method for locating the element (e.g., Class, Selector, XPath).
- "Identifier" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The identifier used for element selection.
- [Index / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.]: The index of the element if there are multiple elements with the same identifier.
- -> VAR/CAP "NAME": The name of the variable where the Y coordinate will be stored.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: The Y coordinate is measured in pixels from the top of the browser window.
Accuracy in element identification is crucial for correct Y coordinate retrieval.

item.name: Get Text
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumGetText' block extracts text content from a specified web element. It is particularly useful for retrieving visible text from web pages, which can be used for validations, data extraction, or further processing within a script.

parameters.parameter: - [FindElementBy]: The method for locating the element (e.g., Class, Selector, XPath).
- "Identifier" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The identifier used for element selection.
- [Index / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.]: The index of the element if there are multiple elements with the same identifier.
- -> VAR/CAP "NAME": The name of the variable where the text will be stored.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Text retrieved is the visible text, not including hidden elements or attributes.
Ensure accuracy in the element's identification for reliable text extraction.

item.name: Is Displayed
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumIsDisplayed' block checks if a specified web element is currently visible on the webpage. It's useful for verifying the presence and visibility of elements as part of web automation tasks.

parameters.parameter: - [FindElementBy]: The method for locating the element (e.g., Class, Selector, XPath).
- "Identifier" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The identifier used for element selection.
- [Index / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.]: The index of the element if there are multiple elements with the same identifier.
- -> VAR/CAP "NAME": The name of the variable to store the result (true if displayed, false otherwise).
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Enables safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Visibility is determined by whether the element occupies space and is not hidden via CSS.
An element not being displayed does not necessarily mean it's absent from the DOM.

item.name: Is Enabled
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumIsEnabled' block evaluates whether a specified web element is enabled, meaning it is interactive and can respond to user actions. This is particularly useful for verifying the state of form elements, buttons, or other interactive elements on a webpage.

parameters.parameter: - [FindElementBy]: The method for locating the element (e.g., Class, Selector, XPath).
- "Identifier" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The identifier used for element selection.
- [Index / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.]: The index of the element if there are multiple elements with the same identifier.
- -> VAR/CAP "NAME": The name of the variable to store the result (true if enabled, false otherwise).
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: An element being enabled means it can be interacted with, such as a clickable button or a fillable text field.
This block is useful for automated testing scenarios to ensure elements are in the expected state before proceeding.

item.name: Is Selected
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumIsSelected' block in Selenium checks whether a specific web element, typically a form input like a checkbox or radio button, is currently selected. This is essential for validating user selections or ensuring that the correct options are pre-selected in automated tests.

parameters.parameter: - [FindElementBy]: The method to locate the element (e.g., Id, Class, XPath).
- "Identifier" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The identifier to find the element.
- [Index / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.]: The index of the element if multiple elements match the identifier.
- -> VAR/CAP "NAME": The variable name to store the result (true if selected, false otherwise).
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Primarily used for checkboxes and radio buttons to verify their selection state.

item.name: Location X
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumLocationX' block in Selenium retrieves the X-coordinate of the top-left corner of a specified web element. This is useful for determining the element's position on the webpage.

parameters.parameter: - [FindElementBy]: The method to locate the element (e.g., Id, Class, XPath).
- "Identifier" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The identifier to find the element.
- [Index / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.]: The index of the element if multiple elements match the identifier.
- -> VAR/CAP "NAME": The variable name to store the X-coordinate value of the element.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Coordinates are relative to the top-left corner of the web page.

item.name: Location Y
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumLocationY' block in Selenium is used for retrieving the Y-coordinate of the top-left corner of a specified web element. It's useful for identifying the vertical position of elements on a webpage.

parameters.parameter: - [FindElementBy]: The method to locate the element (e.g., Id, Class, XPath).
- "Identifier" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The unique identifier for finding the element.
- [Index / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.]: Index of the element if multiple elements match the identifier.
- -> VAR/CAP "NAME": The variable name to store the Y-coordinate value.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Y-coordinates are measured from the top edge of the web page.

item.name: Screenshot Element
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumScreenshotElement' block in Selenium is designed to capture a screenshot of a specific web element on the page and save it as an image file. This is particularly useful for capturing visual evidence during automated testing or web scraping.

parameters.parameter: - [FindElementBy]: The method to locate the element (e.g., Id, Class, XPath).
- "Identifier" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The unique identifier for finding the element.
- Index / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: Index of the element if multiple elements match the identifier.
- "FileName" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The name or path of the file where the screenshot will be saved.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Ensure that the file path provided for the screenshot is accessible and writable.
The screenshot captures only the specified element, not the entire webpage.

item.name: Screenshot Element Base64
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumScreenshotBase64' block is used in Selenium automation to capture a screenshot of a specific element on the web page and encode it as a base64 string. This can be useful for embedding images directly in HTML or CSS code, storing images in databases, or transmitting them over the network without using image files.

parameters.parameter: - [FindElementBy]: Specifies the method to locate the web element (such as Id, Name, XPath).
- "Identifier" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The unique identifier for the web element to be captured.
- [Index / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.]: The index of the element, in case multiple elements match the identifier.
- -> VAR/CAP "NAME": The variable where the base64 encoded screenshot will be stored.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Ensure that the element exists and is visible on the page to capture an accurate screenshot.

item.name: Select
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumSelect' block in Selenium is designed to choose a specific value from a dropdown list (select element) on a web page. It is especially useful for forms or settings where selection from predefined options is required.

parameters.parameter: - [FindElementBy]: Specifies the method for locating the select element (Id, Name, XPath, etc.).
- "Identifier" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The unique identifier of the select element.
- Index / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The index of the select element if multiple elements match the identifier.
- "Value" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The value to be selected from the dropdown list.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Ensure that the value to be selected matches exactly with one of the options in the dropdown list.

item.name: Select By Index
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumSelectByIndex' block in Selenium is designed for selecting an option from a dropdown list based on its index. This block is particularly useful when you need to select an option without knowing its value or text, but you know its position in the dropdown.

parameters.parameter: - [FindElementBy]: Method to locate the select element (Id, Name, XPath, etc.).
- "Identifier" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: Identifier for the select element.
- [Index / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.]: The index of the select element if multiple elements are found.
- [SelectionIndex / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.]: The zero-based index of the option to be selected.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: The index is zero-based, meaning the first option is at index 0.
Ensure the dropdown list is loaded and the options are accessible before attempting to select.

item.name: Select By Text
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumSelectByText' block is used in Selenium to select an option from a dropdown list based on its visible text. This block is especially useful for interacting with select elements when the text of the option is known.

parameters.parameter: - [FindElementBy]: Method to locate the select element (Id, Name, XPath, etc.).
- "Identifier" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: Identifier for the select element.
- Index / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The index of the select element if multiple elements are found.
- "Text" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The visible text of the option to be selected.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Ensure the select element and the option text are correctly identified.

item.name: Clear Field
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumClearField' block is designed to clear the text present in an input field. It's particularly useful in situations where you need to reset the content of a text box or a similar input element before entering new data.

parameters.parameter: - [FindElementBy]: The method used to locate the input field (Id, Name, XPath, etc.).
- "Identifier" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The identifier of the input field.
- [Index / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.]: The index of the input field if multiple elements are found.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Make sure the element is visible and interactable before attempting to clear it.
This block is only effective with input fields that allow text input.

item.name: Type
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumTypeElement' block is used for typing text into an input field in a Selenium-controlled browser. This block simulates the action of typing, allowing for dynamic interaction with web elements that require text input.

parameters.parameter: - [FindElementBy]: The method used to locate the input field (Id, Name, XPath, etc.).
- "Identifier" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The identifier of the input field.
- Index / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The index of the input field if multiple elements are found.
- "Text" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The text to be typed into the field.
- [TimeBetweenKeystrokes / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.]: The delay (in milliseconds) between each keystroke.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Adjusting the 'TimeBetweenKeystrokes' can simulate more natural typing speeds.
Make sure the element is interactable before sending text to it.

item.name: Type Human
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumTypeElementHuman' block in Selenium is designed to simulate human-like typing in an input field. It adds random delays between keystrokes to mimic the natural typing pattern of a human, enhancing the realism of automated scripts.

parameters.parameter: - [FindElementBy]: The method used to locate the input field (Id, Name, XPath, etc.).
- "Identifier" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The identifier of the input field.
- Index / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The index of the input field if multiple elements are found.
- "Text" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The text to be typed into the field.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: The delays between keystrokes are randomized to closely mimic human typing behavior.

item.name: Submit
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumSubmit' block is utilized to submit a form within a web page using Selenium. It's especially useful for automating form submission processes in web testing scenarios.

parameters.parameter: - [FindElementBy]: The method used to locate the form or a form element (Id, Name, XPath, etc.).
- "Identifier" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The identifier of the form or a form element.
- [Index / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.]: The index of the form or the form element if multiple elements are found.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: This block can submit the form directly or by finding a submit button within the form.

item.name: Switch To Frame
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumSwitchToFrame' block is used to switch the context from the main page to a specified iframe within the page, allowing for interactions with elements inside the iframe.

parameters.parameter: - [FindElementBy]: The method used to locate the iframe (Id, Name, XPath, etc.).
- "Identifier" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The identifier of the iframe.
- [Index / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.]: The index of the iframe if multiple iframes are found.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Ensure the iframe is fully loaded before attempting to switch to it.

item.name: Wait For Element
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumWaitForElement' block in Selenium is used to pause the execution of a script until a specific element becomes present or visible on the web page. It is particularly useful in scenarios where the elements load dynamically.

parameters.parameter: - [FindElementBy]: The method used to locate the element (Id, Name, XPath, etc.).
- "Identifier" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The identifier of the element to wait for.
- [Timeout / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.]: Maximum time (in milliseconds) to wait for the element to appear.
- [Visible?]: Optional. Set to true if waiting for the element to become visible, false to just check for presence.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Adjust the timeout according to the expected load time of the element.

item.name: Navigate To
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumNavigateTo' block in Selenium facilitates navigation to a specified URL within the current browser session. It's an essential tool for directing the automated browser to specific web pages for further actions.

parameters.parameter: - "Url" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The URL to navigate to.
- [Timeout / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.]: The time in milliseconds to wait for the page to load before timing out.
- [BanOnTimeout?]: Optional. Whether to set the status to BAN after a timeout.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Ensure the URL is valid and accessible to avoid navigation errors.
Adjust the timeout based on the expected page load time and network speed.

item.name: Get Cookies
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumGetCookies' block is utilized to retrieve cookies from the browser for a specified domain. It's particularly useful for sessions where tracking or maintaining cookies is crucial for web automation tasks.

parameters.parameter: - "Domain" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The domain for which cookies are to be retrieved.
- -> VAR/CAP "NAME": The variable to store the retrieved cookies.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: The domain should be specified accurately to ensure the correct cookies are fetched.

item.name: 3rd-Party Cookies
item.introduction: The 'Puppeteer3rdPartyCookies' block is designed to control the browser's third-party cookie settings using Puppeteer. This functionality is critical for managing privacy and security settings, especially in automated testing and web scraping scenarios where third-party cookies may affect the behavior of the website being accessed.

parameters.parameter: - "ACTION" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The action to be performed on third-party cookies. This can either be "allowThirdParty" to allow third-party cookies or "blockThirdParty" to block them.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling, providing additional protection against unexpected issues during the execution of the block.

notes.note: Choosing the correct ACTION is crucial for the intended behavior of the website under test. Allowing third-party cookies might be necessary for websites that require them for functionality, while blocking them can enhance privacy and security.

item.name: Clear Cookies
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumClearCookies' block is designed to remove all cookies stored for a specific webpage in the browser. This is particularly useful for managing session data or resetting the browser state during automation tasks.

parameters.parameter: - [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Clearing cookies will remove all session data and can affect subsequent automation steps that rely on these cookies.

item.name: Set Cookies
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumSetCookies' block allows the setting of specific cookies for a given domain in the browser page. This is useful for managing browser sessions and customizing the browser state for automation tasks.

parameters.parameter: - ["Domain" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.]: The domain where the cookies will be set.
- [COOKIE "abc: def"]: Defines a cookie to be set. Multiple COOKIE parameters can be added.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

item.example:
SeleniumSetCookies COOKIE "session: abc123"
SeleniumSetCookies "example.com" COOKIE "session: abc123"

notes.note: Ensure the correct domain and valid cookie syntax are used.

item.name: Get DOM
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumGetDOM' block is designed to retrieve the full Document Object Model (DOM) of a web page in Selenium. This feature is particularly useful for extracting the complete HTML structure of a page for further processing or analysis.

parameters.parameter: - [-> VAR/CAP "NAME"]: The variable where the DOM will be stored. This variable can be marked for capture if necessary.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Ensure that the web page is fully loaded before attempting to get the DOM.
The retrieved DOM will be the current state of the page, including any dynamic changes made after page load.
If the [VAR/CAP "NAME"] is left empty, storing the DOM in '<SOURCE>', which is a general variable.

item.name: Switch To Main Frame
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumSwitchToMainFrame' block is designed for navigating back to the main frame of a web page in Selenium. This is especially useful when working with pages that contain multiple iframes or framesets, allowing for a reset to the main document context.

parameters.parameter: - [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Use this block after interacting with elements inside an iframe to ensure subsequent actions are performed in the main document context.
This block does not navigate to a different page or refresh the current page; it only changes the context to the main document.

item.name: Switch To Parent Frame
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumSwitchToParentFrame' block is utilized for navigating back to the parent frame of the current iframe in a web page when using Selenium. This block simplifies the task of moving out of a nested frame to its immediate parent frame in the DOM hierarchy.

parameters.parameter: - [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: This block is especially useful when working with deeply nested frames, allowing for a step-by-step ascent to the desired frame level.
Remember that this block only navigates to the immediate parent frame, not to the main or default content of the page.

item.name: Switch To Alert Frame
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumSwitchToAlertFrame' block is used for handling JavaScript alerts, confirms, and prompts in web pages. This block enables Selenium to focus on the alert dialog, allowing for further interactions like accepting, dismissing, or inputting text into these dialogs.

parameters.parameter: - [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Ensure that an alert is present before using this block to avoid exceptions.

item.name: Key Press in Page
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumPageKeyPress' block simulates a key press and release action on the current browser page. It's useful for scenarios where keyboard input is required, such as filling out forms or triggering keyboard shortcuts.

parameters.parameter: - "KEY" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The key to be pressed and released. The value should be in string format and represent a valid key according to Puppeteer's keyboard API. A full list of keys can be found in the Puppeteer documentation (https://github.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/blob/v1.14.0/lib/USKeyboardLayout.js).
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Ensure that the focus is on the correct element or area in the page where the key press is intended.

item.name: Key Down in Page
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumPageKeyDown' block is designed to simulate a key press action in a browser page without releasing the key. It's particularly useful for scenarios that require holding down a key, such as activating keyboard shortcuts or continuous actions.

parameters.parameter: - "KEY" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The key to be pressed down. The value should be a string that matches one of the keys in Puppeteer's keyboard API. Refer to Puppeteer documentation for a comprehensive list of supported keys (https://github.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/blob/v1.14.0/lib/USKeyboardLayout.js).
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Make sure to use the 'SeleniumPageKeyUp' block afterwards to release the key if necessary.
Consider the focus of the page and the element that the key press is targeting.

item.name: Key Up in Page
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumPageKeyUp' block is used for releasing a key that was previously pressed down in the browser page. It is essential for ending a continuous key press action initiated by a 'SeleniumPageKeyDown' block.

parameters.parameter: - "KEY" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: Specifies the key to be released. The value should correspond to a key in Puppeteer's keyboard API. For a complete list of key names supported by Puppeteer, refer to: https://github.com/puppeteer/puppeteer/blob/v1.14.0/lib/USKeyboardLayout.js.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Be mindful of the focus on the page to ensure the key release action occurs in the intended context.

item.name: Screenshot Page
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumScreenshotPage' block captures a screenshot of the entire browser page and saves it to a specified file. This is particularly useful for capturing the current state of a webpage for documentation, testing, or debugging purposes.

parameters.parameter: - "FileName" / $"variable" / etc.: The path and filename where the screenshot will be saved. Supports variable input.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Ensure the specified file path exists and is writable.
The saved screenshot is a snapshot of the page at the moment the block is executed, including any dynamic content or pop-ups.

item.name: Screenshot Page Base64
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumScreenshotPageBase64' block is designed to capture a screenshot of the entire browser page and convert it into a base64 string.

parameters.parameter: - -> VAR/CAP "NAME": The name of the variable where the Base64 encoded string of the screenshot will be stored.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: The base64 string can be large, depending on the content and resolution of the page.

item.name: Type in Page
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumPageType' block allows for sending text input directly to the current page. This is typically used for typing text into fields or triggering specific keyboard events on the page.

parameters.parameter: - "Text" / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The text that will be typed into the page. This parameter accepts both constant and variable types
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: This block can be used to simulate user typing in any input field or area within the page.
Ensure the desired element is in focus if specific input fields need to be targeted.

item.name: Scroll By
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumScrollBy' block is used to scroll the current page by a specified number of pixels in the horizontal (X) and vertical (Y) directions.

parameters.parameter: - X / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.: The horizontal pixel distance to scroll. Positive values scroll right, negative values scroll left.
- [Y / $"variable" / CS"code" / etc.]: The vertical pixel distance to scroll. Positive values scroll down, negative values scroll up.
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Scrolling is relative to the current position of the page.
Ensure the page has finished loading and is scrollable before using this block.

item.name: Execute Js
item.introduction: The 'SeleniumExecuteJs' block executes a JavaScript expression in the current page and returns the result as a JSON string. This block is useful for interacting with the page's DOM or triggering JavaScript-based events.

parameters.parameter: - [-> VAR/CAP "NAME"]: The name of the variable where the result of the JS expression will be stored
- [SAFE?]: Optional. Activates safe mode for error handling.

notes.note: Make sure the JavaScript expression returns a value, especially if capturing output.

item.name: If Else

introduction.line: The 'IF' statement checks the specified condition.

If the condition is true, it proceeds with the following commands; otherwise, it jumps to the first 'ELSE', 'ELIF' or 'ENDIF' statement. The 'ELSE' statement executes commands when the 'IF' condition is false. 'ELIF' provides an additional conditional check within an 'IF'...'ENDIF' structure.

item.line: IF "STRING1" CONDITION "STRING2" ## COMMANDS TO BE EXECUTED ON TRUE CONDITION ELIF "STRING3" CONDITION "STRING4" ## COMMANDS TO BE EXECUTED ON ELIF TRUE CONDITION ELSE ## COMMANDS TO BE EXECUTED ON FALSE CONDITION ENDIF
item.example: IF $"<status>" EqualTo "active" ## Perform actions for active status ELIF $"<status>" EqualTo "pending" ## Perform actions for pending status ELSE ## Perform actions if status is neither active nor pending ENDIF

notes.note: The 'ELIF' statement allows for multiple conditional branches within a single 'IF' statement, making the script more flexible and organized.
It's important to ensure that the conditions in 'IF' and 'ELIF' statements are mutually exclusive to avoid unexpected behavior.

item.name: While
item.introduction: The 'WHILE' statement repeatedly executes a block of commands as long as a specified condition is true. The 'ENDWHILE' statement marks the end of the loop. The 'Continue' statement within a 'WHILE' loop skips the remaining commands in the current iteration and jumps back to the start of the 'WHILE' loop for the next iteration.
item.syntax: WHILE "STRING1" CONDITION "STRING2" ## COMMANDS TO BE EXECUTED IN EACH ITERATION CONTINUE ## THESE COMMANDS ARE SKIPPED IF CONTINUE IS EXECUTED BREAK ## THESE COMMANDS ARE SKIPPED AND LOOP IS TERMINATED IF BREAK IS EXECUTED ENDWHILE
item.example: SET VAR "counter" "1" Integer WHILE $"<counter>" LessThan "10" PRINT $"<counter>" Red SUM $"<counter>" ENDWHILE

notes.note: The 'Continue' statement is useful for skipping over certain iterations within a loop based on specific conditions. Be cautious when using 'Continue' to avoid creating infinite loops. Ensure that the loop has a clear exit condition.

The 'BREAK' statement immediately terminates the loop, regardless of the original condition. It is useful for exiting the loop early based on a specific condition that is checked within the loop. Use 'BREAK' judiciously to prevent unexpected termination of loops.

item.name: Jump
item.introduction: The JUMP statement will jump to the first block with the specified label (within the script!).

item.name: Begin (End) Script

introduction.line: The BEGIN SCRIPT statement will mark an area of the script where the commands will be executed using another scripting language.
The OUTPUTS literal can contain a comma-separated list of variable names that you want to extract from the script's scope and declare inside OB as strings or lists.

It is useful to mention that your normal variables will be automatically declared inside the script as strings / lists of strings / dictionaries (if their name is allowed by that language's standards).
Available languages:
JavaScript (Engines: Jint,Noesis)
IronPython
CSharp
NodeJs

notes.note: 'Z.Expressions' is a library that allows compiling and executing dynamic C# expressions, providing flexibility for script-based C# code execution within the main script.
Variables defined in the C# script can be returned to the main program by specifying them in the 'VARS' clause.
Ensure that variable names used in the C# script follow the naming conventions of both the scripting language and the 'Z.Expressions' library.
